alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 8:25PM EDT until July 12 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Contoocook River At Henniker affecting Merrimack and Hillsborough Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Sugar River At West Claremont affecting Sullivan County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Warner River at Davisville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Riverside Road floods along with increasing depths over recreational fields in Warner. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.4 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
